title: Switzerland’s Nemo wins Eurovision after contest roiled by protests over Gaza war
summary: The singer won on Saturday night with 'The Code,' an operatic ode to the artist’s journey toward embracing their nongender identity. The victory in the Swedish city of Malmo followed a turbulent year for the pop contest that saw large street protests against the participation of Israel.

title: Renaud Van Ruymbeke, French judge who investigated major political and corruption cases, has died
summary: Over a career spanning decades, Van Ruymbeke became an icon of the fight against corruption.

title: Xi Jinping has chosen his European camp
summary: The Chinese president's first tour of Europe in five years was above all an opportunity to reaffirm Beijing's economic and geopolitical ambitions.

title: Australia and Tuvalu finalize historic treaty to welcome climate refugees
summary: On Thursday, the two countries agreed on an explanatory memorandum to put an end to debates on the treaty's security points. The text should come into effect by the end of the year.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'If the West truly supports the two-state solution, it must sanction Israel'
summary: In his column, the economist calls on the US and Europe to hit Benjamin Netanyahu and his allies in the wallet.

title: Paris 2024: In synchronized swimming, the Aleksiiva twins determined to 'show Ukraine's fighting spirit'
summary: Forced to flee the destroyed swimming pools of Kharkiv, twins Maryna and Vladyslava Aleksiiva are preparing for the Olympics as best they can.

title: In pictures | First 'extreme' solar storm in 20 years fills skies with spectacular northern lights
summary: The planet is experiencing an 'extreme' geomagnetic event and it could potentially disrupt power and communications.

title: What we know about the Chinese espionage operation targeting French lawmakers
summary: In January 2021, several elected representatives received emails sent by APT31, a hacker group suspected of being controlled by Beijing. MEP François-Xavier Bellamy has announced his intention to file a complaint.

title: Xi Jinping flatters and seeks to boost Eurosceptic leaders
summary: Welcomed with great pomp in Serbia and Hungary, the Chinese leader praised China's economic partnerships with the two countries, with which he shares a mistrust of the EU.

title: Israel strikes Gaza, orders more Rafah evacuations
summary: Residents on Saturday have been ordered to go to the 'humanitarian zone' of Al-Mawasi, on the coast northwest of Rafah.

title: Mbappé says he will leave PSG at end of season
summary: Football star Kylian Mbappé confirmed on Friday that he would be leaving Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the season but didn't reveal his new club.

title: More than 300 dead in Afghanistan flash floods
summary: Heavy rains on Friday sent roaring rivers of water and mud crashing through villages in multiple Afghan provinces.

title: Palestinian Authority receives broad support in symbolic UN vote
summary: 143 of the 193 member states considered on Friday that Palestine meets the criteria for full membership of the United Nations. The US voted against the resolution.

title: New political crisis in Kuwait, emir dissolves parliament
summary: Parliament, elected in early April, was to meet for the first time on Monday. But several MPs have refused to participate in the government.

title: Turkey's 'Saturday Mothers' vigils call for answers over enforced disappearances
summary: For many years now, groups of relatives of people who disappeared in Turkey have been holding vigils to seek justice.

title: After Mahamat Idriss Déby's disputed victory in Chad, N'Djamena is under heavy surveillance
summary: The incumbent president officially won 61% of the vote, but his main opponent Succès Masra is contesting the results.

title: The femur was the secret evolutionary boot of giant bipedal dinosaurs
summary: On 12 occasions, the same morphoskeletal adaptations have independently accompanied the development of very massive theropod species.

title: Japan's efforts to develop whaling, a marginal activity elevated to the rank of national pride
summary: Tokyo is about to add fin whales to the list of whales it allows its fishermen to hunt. The decision confirms the determination to promote the practice despite criticism and the Japanese public's low appetite for whale meat.

title: After Israel took control of the Rafah border crossing, humanitarian operations in Gaza at a standstill
summary: Israeli troops have been deployed in a 1-kilometer radius around the border crossing with Egypt, blocking the entry of aid convoys.

title: Childcare at the Cannes Film Festival
summary: To reduce the material difficulties holding back women's careers, the Red Ballon Alliance backed by the Collectif 50/50 has been offering festival-goers childcare solutions for their offspring since 2019.

title: US: brain worm parasitizes Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s campaign
summary: The independent candidate confirmed that he had suffered a brain ailment caused by a parasitic worm. One more oddity in a chaotic but progressing campaign that is beginning to worry Donald Trump.

title: Lyon's daring gastronomy scene knows no boundaries
summary: Cotton candy and foie gras, soy meringue, Chinese dim sum with Guémené andouille sausage: Some adventurous chefs are shaking up the culinary traditions of the capital of the Gauls, with a cuisine that's both hybrid and daring.

title: Roger Corman, Hollywood mentor and 'King of the Bs,' dies at 98
summary: The American film director who gave many of Hollywood's most famous actors and directors early breaks, died on Thursday. The roots of Hollywood’s golden age in the 1970s can be found in Corman’s films.

title: Catalonia votes in crucial elections
summary: Sunday's elections in Catalonia are a test for the pro-independence movement. They will also be decisive for Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.

title: 'Commentaries on Taylor Swift's influence are revealing of the polarization of American political life'
summary: As the pop star continues a series of concerts in Paris, historian Manuel Bocquier explores her potential influence on the US presidential election.

title: From Gaza to Odesa, the journey of a Ukrainian family evacuated from one war to another
summary: Over 300 people from Ukraine have been evacuated from the Palestinian territory. Among them, a group of women and their children have taken refuge in the large Ukrainian port city, also subjected to bombings.

title: Rafah, the strategic crossing at the heart of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict
summary: The status of the terminal between the Sinai desert and the Gaza Strip, recently conquered by the Israeli army, has changed over the years.

title: Brioni's long heritage of suiting up cinema's leading men
summary: From Mastroianni's unforgettable white suit in 'La Dolce Vita' to the impeccable three-piece suits of the James Bond saga, the Italian tailor dresses actors on and off screen. Renowned for its refinement, the Roman house founded in 1945 has managed to steal the spotlight from British tailoring.

title: Four American artists honored at Venice Biennale
summary: Alex Katz, Willem De Kooning, Robert Indiana and Jim Dine have exhibitions in conjunction with the contemporary art Biennale.

title: Neo-fascists march through Paris despite government commitment to ban ultra-right demonstrations
summary: Several hundred people took part in the event organized by the Comité du 9 Mai and authorized by the Paris Administrative Court on Saturday.

title: Five Lyon restaurants with international flavors
summary: Gastronomic Mexican, vegetarian haute cuisine, the molecular surprises of a Michelin-starred chef... Five ways to move away from the traditional bouchon.

title: A gentle retreat in Corsica
summary: At the entrance to Cap Corse, 300 meters above the sea, the Couvent de Pozzo, a convent built in the 15th century, is a guest house steeped in history, providing a welcoming place to stay along with regional fare.

title: Travel: Evian reconnects with its Belle Epoque past
summary: The city on the shores of Lake Geneva is restoring its Art Nouveau heritage that bore witness to the golden age of thermalism. The casino, palaces and 1913 funicular offer a glimpse into the era's opulence and exquisite refinement.

title: Djokovic suffers shock elimination from Rome Open
summary: The Serb lost 6-2, 6-3 to Chilean Tabilo, who is ranked 32nd in the world.

title: Thousands evacuated from border areas in Ukraine's Kharkiv region
summary: Russia said Sunday it had captured four more villages in the region where it launched a surprise ground offensive on Friday.

title: AI cameras tested in Cannes ahead of Olympics
summary: The technology, which never truly proved its worth, is supposed to 'identify events or behaviors deemed suspicious.'
